Scroll-Driven Animation

Modern CSS motion using animation-timeline: view() and scroll()

Scroll to explore

CSS Scroll-Driven Animations

No JavaScript needed for scroll-linked animations. The animation-timeline property connects animations directly to scroll progress.

  • animation-timeline: view() - Animate based on element visibility
  • animation-timeline: scroll() - Animate based on scroll position
  • animation-range - Control when animation starts/ends
  • prefers-reduced-motion - Respect user preferences

Features That Reveal on Scroll

@

Zero JavaScript

Scroll-driven animations are pure CSS. No IntersectionObserver needed.

#

GPU Accelerated

Browser optimizes animations for smooth 60fps performance.

*

Declarative

Define animations in CSS, let the browser handle timing.

!

Accessible

Respects prefers-reduced-motion automatically when coded correctly.

The Pattern

/* Element reveals as it enters viewport */
.reveal-on-scroll {
  opacity: 0;
  transform: translateY(50px);

  /* Connect to scroll timeline */
  animation: reveal linear both;
  animation-timeline: view();
  animation-range: entry 0% entry 50%;
}

@keyframes reveal {
  to {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateY(0);
  }
}

/* Scroll progress bar */
.progress-bar {
  transform: scaleX(0);
  animation: progress linear;
  animation-timeline: scroll();
}

@keyframes progress {
  to { transform: scaleX(1); }
}

View Transitions API

Click a Card for View Transition

The View Transitions API enables smooth animated transitions between DOM states.

Card One

Click to expand

Card Two

Click to expand

Card Three

Click to expand

/* Trigger view transition for theme switch */
document.getElementById('theme-select').addEventListener('change', (e) => {
  if (!document.startViewTransition) {
    document.body.dataset.theme = e.target.value;
    return;
  }

  document.startViewTransition(() => {
    document.body.dataset.theme = e.target.value;
  });
});

/* CSS for transition styles */
::view-transition-old(root),
::view-transition-new(root) {
  animation-duration: 0.3s;
}

View Transitions

Fallback Strategy

Features degrade gracefully. Non-supporting browsers show static content.
